posts.post_content:
What does this card do? It hates on fliers, but isn't worthless on non-fliers. It isn't great at any specific task, but it has versatility. I agree that this card is unplayable in most competitive games. We are so used to power creep, when we pay four mana, the creature needs to be dead or we say the card is over-costed. However, back in Homelands, this card was not only appropriately costed, but it was an appropriate rarity, too. Here's why:  
  
This card is GREEN removal that targets ANY creature and additionally HATES ON FLIERS!  
  
In the old days, green didn't really disable creatures without flying. I did a gatherer search including all green cards printed before and up to Alliances, and here's your options: [Desert Twister](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Desert Twister) or [Tornado](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tornado) (if you wanted the versatility to kill any creature), otherwise you could use a card like [Roots](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Roots) (disables a non-flier) or [Snowblind](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Snowblind) (disables any creature, but def... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

In the old days, green didn't really disable creatures without flying. Posted By: kowrip (8/31/2010 12:29:06 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
@Three\_toe,  
  
Okay, let's compare this to cards printed BEFORE this. You'll see that even by those standards this is quite bad.  
  
[Earthbind](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Earthbind) costs just one mana, is a common and can double as a sorcery speed [Shock](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Shock).  
  
[Vertigo](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vertigo) is identical to Earthbind except that it is uncommon and an instant.  
  
[Whiteout](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Whiteout) costs just two mana, is an instant, is an uncommon, affects ALL creatures with flying and can be recurred indefinitely assuming you aren't mana-screwed and have built your deck with snow lands.  
  
[Gravity Sphere](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gravity Sphere) costs three mana, and affects all creatures.
posts.html:
@Three_toe,

Okay, let's compare this to cards printed BEFORE this. You'll see that even by those standards this is quite bad.

Earthbind costs just one mana, is a common and can double as a sorcery speed Shock.

Vertigo is identical to Earthbind except that it is uncommon and an instant.

Whiteout costs just two mana, is an instant, is an uncommon, affects ALL creatures with flying and can be recurred indefinitely assuming you aren't mana-screwed and have built your deck with snow lands.

Gravity Sphere costs three mana, and affects all creatures.

Posted By: Shadoflaam (10/20/2011 6:02:55 PM)

posts.post_content: I know that a lot of you commenting are 16-ish and haven't developed your reasoning well enough, but let me help you out. You are comparing the card to cards printed many years later, after the game has changed *significantly*. Stop complaining that WotC doesn't know what they are doing. There was a point, before Baneslayer Angel existed, you know, and the cards were less powerful. But here's the thing, they were ALL less powerful, so it evened out. There were still better rares than others, but try to imagine a time before everything had to win you the game in 2 turns to be playable. Personally I liked the more thematic designs, like this one, better than the "i created a creature... it's flying, white and has deathtouch. hmm, we'll call it deathtouch angel" days.
posts.html:
